articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military has withdrawn from an area of Gaza known as the Netzarim corridor that bisects the enclave, Hamas said on Sunday, a move that was expected under the ceasefire agreement between Israel and the Palestinian militant group.
articles.title: Hamas says Israeli military withdraws from Gaza's Netzarim Corridor

articles.author: Marc Jones, Steven Scheer
articles.description: A historic shake-up of the Middle East is starting to draw international investors, warming to the prospects of relative peace and economic recovery after so much turmoil.
articles.title: New look Middle East had started to draw investors... and then came Trump

articles.author: Olivia Kumwenda-Mtambo, Catherine Schenck
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump's offer to rehouse white South Africans as refugees fleeing persecution may not spur quite the rush he anticipates, as even right-wing white lobby groups want to "tackle the injustices" of Black majority rule on home soil.
articles.title: 'No thanks': White South Africans turn down Trump's immigration offer

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Five Thai nationals held captive by Hamas for over a year returned to Thailand on Sunday, reuniting with their tearful families at Bangkok's Suvarnabhumi Airport.
articles.title: Thai nationals held captive by Hamas for 15 months return home

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Egypt will host an emergency Arab summit on 27 February to discuss what it described as "serious" developments for Palestinians, according to a statement from the Egyptian foreign ministry on Sunday.
articles.title: Egypt to host emergency Arab summit on 27 February to discuss 'serious' Palestinian developments

articles.author: Tora Agarwala
articles.description: The chief minister of India's northeastern state of Manipur resigned on Sunday, bowing to pressure to quit amid ongoing ethnic clashes that have cost at least 250 lives since they broke out nearly two years ago.
articles.title: Chief of violence-hit Indian state of Manipur resigns

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said that he has talked to Russian President Vladimir Putin on the phone to discuss an end to the war in Ukraine, the New York Post reported late on Saturday.
articles.title: Trump says he has spoken to Putin about ending war in Ukraine, the New York Post reports

articles.author: Tim Cocks
articles.description: A law that allows the government to confiscate land has reignited racial tensions that have dogged Africa's southernmost tip ever since European settlers began arriving nearly four centuries ago.
articles.title: The stark divide that South Africa's land act seeks to bridge

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Sam Nujoma, the activist and guerrilla leader who became Namibia's first democratically elected president after it won its independence from apartheid South Africa, died aged 95 on Saturday, the Namibian Presidency said in a post on X on Sunday.
articles.title: Namibia's 'founding father' Sam Nujoma dies aged 95, Presidency says

articles.author: Gram Slattery
articles.description: Israeli President Isaac Herzog said on Sunday that U.S. President Donald Trump was set to meet with Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi and possibly Saudi Arabian Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, although he gave no dates for the talks.
articles.title: Trump to meet with leaders of Saudi Arabia and Egypt, Israeli president says
